gov.cms.qrda.validator.web.service

Interface FileService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FileServiceImpl

    public interface FileService
    An interface describing the file-related operations required in the QRDA Validator application.
    Author:
    Dan Donahue, ESAC Inc.

    • Method Summary

      • loadPropertiesExt

        java.util.Properties loadPropertiesExt(java.lang.String filename)
        Loads a properties file where the file is on an external directory on the server, under a "properties" folder. By default, look in <QRDA_HOME>/qrda/properties.
        Parameters:
        filename, - the name of the properties file to open
        Returns:
        The properties file

                             java.lang.String key,
                             java.lang.String defaultVal)
        Get a property with a string value from the given resource (e.g. "validator.properties"). Provide a default value to use if the given key is not found
        Parameters:
        propertiesFilename, - the name of the properties file to open
        key, - the key to search for
        defaultVal, - the value to return if the key is not found
        Returns:
        the value of the key in the file, or the default value

      • openExtFileForReading

        java.io.FileInputStream openExtFileForReading(java.lang.String baseDir,
                                              java.lang.String subDir,
                                              java.lang.String filename)
        Opens a file for reading. The file is expected to be in the QRDA filespace located in QRDA_HOME/qrda on the server. BaseDir represents the immediate subfolder under the qrda folder (One of "isofiles", "schematrons", "testfiles" or "result"). The subDir argument is a subfolder under the baseDir folder (For example "HL7", "HQR", "CEC", or "PQRS"). The filename is the name of the file in the qrda/baseDir/subDir directory.
        Parameters:
        baseDir, - the base directory name
        subDir, - the directory under the base directory to look in
        filename, - the name of the file to open
        Returns:
        the input stream of the file

      • openExtFileForWriting

        java.io.FileOutputStream openExtFileForWriting(java.lang.String baseDir,
                                               java.lang.String subDir,
                                               java.lang.String filename)
        Opens a file for writing. The file is expected to be created in the QRDA filespace located in QRDA_HOME/qrda on the server. BaseDir represents the immediate subfolder under the qrda folder (One of "schematrons", "testfiles" or "result"). The subDir argument is a subfolder under the baseDir folder (For example "HL7", "HQR", "CEC", or "PQRS"). The filename is the name of the file in the qrda/baseDir/subDir directory.
        Parameters:
        baseDir, - the base directory name
        subDir, - the directory under the base directory to look in
        filename, - the name of the file to open
        Returns:
        the output stream of the file

      • readExtFileUnparsed

        java.lang.String readExtFileUnparsed(java.lang.String baseDir,
                                     java.lang.String subDir,
                                     java.lang.String filename)
        Opens a file and returns the contents of the file as a String. The file is expected to be in the QRDA filespace located in QRDA_HOME/qrda on the server. BaseDir represents the immediate subfolder under the qrda folder (One of "isofiles", "schematrons", "testfiles" or "result"). The subDir argument is a subfolder under the baseDir folder (For example "HL7", "HQR", "CEC", or "PQRS"). The filename is the name of the file in the qrda/baseDir/subDir directory.
        Parameters:
        baseDir, - the base directory name
        subDir, - the directory under the base directory to look in
        filename, - the name of the file to open
        Returns:
        the contents of a file in a string

      • readExtFileUnparsed

        java.lang.String readExtFileUnparsed(java.lang.String absolutePath)
        Opens a file and returns the contents of the file as a String. This method takes a string argument representing the absolute path to the file on the server.
        Parameters:
        absolutePath, - the full path to a file on the server
        Returns:
        the contents of a file in a string

      • getExtRepositoryFiles

        java.util.ArrayList<FileSpec> getExtRepositoryFiles(java.lang.String baseDir,
                                                    java.lang.String subDir,
                                                    java.lang.String contains,
                                                    boolean sortByDate)
        Returns a list of FileSpec objects representing the files present in the QRDA_HOME/qrda/<baseDir>/subDir folder on the server. The list returned contains FileSpec objects for files only. Directories are not included. Files may be sorted in reverse chronological order by supplying a true value for the sortByDate parameter.
        Parameters:
        baseDir, - the base directory name
        subDir, - the directory under the base directory to look in
        contains, - a filter to include only files containing the given 'contains' string.
        sortByDate, - true to sort files by modified date. (Otherwise, sorted by name.)
        Returns:
        A list of gov.cms.qrda.validator.model.FileSpec objects

      • getExtRepositoryFiles

        java.util.ArrayList<FileSpec> getExtRepositoryFiles(java.lang.String baseDir,
                                                    java.lang.String subDir,
                                                    java.lang.String contains)
        Returns a list of FileSpec objects representing the files present in the QRDA_HOME/qrda/<baseDir>/subDir folder on the server. The list returned contains FileSpec objects for files only. Directories are not included.
        Parameters:
        baseDir, - the base directory name
        subDir, - the directory under the base directory to look in
        contains, - a filter to include only files containing the given 'contains' string.
        Returns:
        A list of gov.cms.qrda.validator.model.FileSpec objects

      • createResultsDir

        boolean createResultsDir(java.lang.String dirname)
        Creates a directory under the QRDA_HOME/qrda/result/ folder on the server. The dirname is the name of the folder to create. The name should not contain characters that are disallowed in folder names.
        Parameters:
        dirname, - the name of the subdirectory to create
        Returns:
        boolean, true if create happened without error

      • renameCategoryDirectories

        void renameCategoryDirectories(java.lang.String currName,
                               java.lang.String newName)
        Renames a category folder under each of the main folders in the QRDA filespace.
        Parameters:
        currName, - Name of folder to rename
        newName, - The new name of the folder

      • createCategoryDirectories

        void createCategoryDirectories(java.lang.String newName)
        Creates a new category folder under each of the main folders in the QRDA filespace
        Parameters:
        newName, - the name of the subdirectory to create under each of the QRDA main folders

      • deleteCategoryDirectories

        boolean deleteCategoryDirectories(java.lang.String catName)
        Removes a category folder (and all of its contents) under each of the main folders in the QRDA filespace
        Parameters:
        catName, - The name of the subdirectory to deep delete
        Returns:
        boolean, true if successful delete.

      • copyIsoFiles

        boolean copyIsoFiles(java.lang.String newName)
        Copies the contents of the original iso file subfolder to a folder under the isofiles directory in the QRDA filespace
        Parameters:
        newName, - name of subdirectory to create
        Returns:
        boolean, true if successful

      • createTestCases

        java.util.List<TestCase> createTestCases(java.lang.String schematronFilename,
                                         java.lang.String schematronType,
                                         java.util.List<java.lang.String> testFilenames,
                                         java.lang.String filenamePostFix,
                                         java.lang.String resultsFolder)
        Returns a list of validation TestCases from a list of filenames of files located in the QRDA_HOME/qrda/testfiles/<schematronType> folder on the server. The filenamePostfix value is appended to results file names that are created as part of each test case. The filenamePostfic values in normally a string representing a data-time value.
        Parameters:
        schematronFilename, - Name of schematron file to test with
        schematronType, - Type (category) of schematron file
        testFilenames, - List of names of files to test
        filenamePostFix, - String to append to end of generated results files, for uniqueness
        resultsFolder, - Name of subdirectory to place results files.
        Returns:
        true if copy was successful

      • uploadFile

        boolean uploadFile(org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file,
                   java.lang.String base,
                   java.lang.String subdir,
                   java.lang.String name)
        Uploads a file from the user's machine into a directory on the validator server. The file is uploaded to the QRDA_HOME/qrda/<base>/subdir directory on the server. If the name argument is non-null and non-empty, the file is given that name. Otherwise, the file retains the name it had on the client's machine.
        Parameters:
        file, - The selected file from an upload file form
        base, - The base directory where the file should go
        subdir, - The subdirectory under the base directory where the file should go
        name, - An alternate name for the file. (Can be null.)
        Returns:
        true if upload was successful

      • deleteFile

        boolean deleteFile(java.lang.String filename,
                   java.lang.String base,
                   java.lang.String subdir)
        Removes the file found in QRDA_HOME/qrda/<base>/<subdir>/<filename>
        Parameters:
        filename, - The file to remove
        base, - The base directory where the file is located
        subdir, - The subdirectory under the base directory where the file is located
        Returns:
        true if delete is successful

      • getAbsolutePath

        java.lang.String getAbsolutePath(java.lang.String filename,
                                 java.lang.String base,
                                 java.lang.String subdir)
        Returns the full (absolute) pathname of the file located in QRDA_HOME/qrda/<base>/</subdir>/<filename>
        Parameters:
        filename, - The actual file name
        base, - The base directory where the file is located
        subdir, - The subdirectory under the base directory where the file is located
        Returns:
        the absolute pathname of the file on disk

      • findExpectedErrorText

        void findExpectedErrorText(java.io.File file,
                           FileSpec spec)
        Test files submitted to the QRDA Validator for validation may have a comment line indicating the number of errors and warnings expected to be present when validated. These values are used in reporting the validation results on the Validator UI. This method searches the first 20 lines of the given file for either of the following text lines: "Total Errors Expected: <n>" "Total Warnings Expected: <m>" If either of those lines are found, the integer values (n and m, above) are entered into the given FileSpec object.
        Parameters:
        file, - A File object
        spec, - A gov.cms.qrda.validator.model.FileSpec object that gets filled in with file data.

      • writeTestSuite

        void writeTestSuite(ValidationSuite vs)
        Serializes the ValidationSuite object to the proper subfolder under the result folder in the QRDA filespace.
        Parameters:
        vs, - The gov.cms.qrda.validator.model.ValidationSuite object to serialize

      • readTestSuite

        ValidationSuite readTestSuite(java.lang.String subDir,
                              java.lang.String filename)
        Reads (unserializes) a ValidationSuite object from the contents of the filename stored in the subDir category folder in the result folder of the QRDA filespace.
        Parameters:
        subDir, - The subdirectory name where the serialized object is stored.
        filename, - The filename that the serialized object is stored in.
        Returns:
        gov.cms.qrda.validator.model.ValidationSuite object

      • convertToURL

        java.lang.String convertToURL(java.lang.String pathname,
                              java.lang.String topDir)
        Takes a full pathname to a file on the server filespace and creates a URL that points to the same file.
        Parameters:
        pathname, - the full path to the file
        topDir, - the top-most directory in the QRDA filespace (e.g. "results" or "testfiles", etc.)
        Returns:
        a URL that references the same file
